comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

This request is to restore the ability of the menubar in Firefox 4 (and preferably, the new add-on bar) to support the display of large icons as it did in previous release versions, perhaps, through an about:config pref override.

This feature can be useful for anyone but is especially helpful as an Accessibility fix for those with disabilities such as Parkinsons, Essential Tremor or limited eyesight where having larger icons improves the chances of clicking on the desired icon. The add-on referenced in the URL above provides for this capability but seems like an overkill solution to the problem.

More discussion on this may be found starting here:
http://bit.ly/kYyzCe

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set View option to display menubar
2. Use Customize to uncheck "Use small icons" checkbox and DnD an icon onto menubar or add-on bar
3.

Actual Results:  
Icons remain small instead of large as was previously the case with earlier releases.

Expected Results:  
Icon sizes to obey the Customize "Use small icons" checkbox setting

It appears that the toolbar's lockiconsize (a new attribute with Fx4) attribute is set to "true". Setting this to "false" or null restores the previous functionality.

The CSS style override would be an acceptable solution but it doesn't seem to stick. If I toggle the "Use small icons" checkbox the toolbar buttons revert to small and stay that way, even after using "! important".

I've confirmed it's there using DOMi but the lockiconsize attribute remains "true".
